Description: An identifier for this tender process. This may be the same as the ocid, or may be drawn from an internally held identifier for this tender.
Tender title
Tender description
[Consult codelist] The current status of the tender e.g. active, cancelled.

The goods and services to be purchased, broken into line items wherever possible. Items should not be duplicated, but a quantity of 2 specified instead.

See Item section for further details.

The minimum estimated value of the procurement.

See Value

The total estimated value of the procurement.

See Value
[Consult codelist] Specify tendering method as per GPA definitions of Open, Selective, Limited (http://www.wto.org/english/docs_e/legal_e/rev-gpr-94_01_e.htm)
Rationale of procurement method, especially in the case of Limited tendering.
[Consult codelist] Specify the award criteria for the procurement.
Any detailed or further information on the selection criteria.
[Consult codelist] Specify the method by which bids must be submitted, in person, written, or electronic auction.

Any detailed or further information on the submission method. This may include the address, e-mail address or online service to which bids should be submitted, and any special requirements to be followed for submissions.

The period when the tender is open for submissions. The end date is the closing date for tender submissions.

See Period

The period during which enquiries may be made and answered.

See Period
A Yes/No field as to whether enquiries were part of tender process.
Description of eligibility criteria for potential suppliers.

The date or period on which an award is anticipated to be made.

See Period

The entity managing the procurement, which may be different from the buyer who is paying / using the items being procured.

See Organization

All documents and attachments related to the tender, including any notices.

See Document section for further details.

A list of milestones associated with the tender.

See Milestone section for further details.
See Amendment
